title: Agents versus traditional GUIs
summary: Notes on when autonomous flows beat menu-driven UX, and the checkpoints needed to keep agent actions explainable.

title: When open-source models actually win
summary: Benchmarks are noisy, but smaller OSS stacks win when latency, control, and cost matter more than SOTA headline scores.

title: Safety docs versus deployment reality
summary: Release notes promise red-teaming and eval gates, yet production launches still hinge on rollout scripts and alerting discipline.

title: Eval fatigue is a product problem
summary: Teams drown in dashboards; what they need are opinionated thresholds, auto-triage, and fewer bespoke scorecards.

title: Why this site is static-first
summary: Flat files, zero runtime, and cheap hosting keep the publishing loop tight while still leaving room for richer experiments later.
